message.content: This question requires some knowledge of plant adaptations to different environmental conditions. In areas with low rainfall, plants that are adapted to desert environments are more likely to thrive. Cacti are well-suited for these conditions because they have developed special adaptations, such as long roots to reach water deep underground, and the ability to store water in their stems. Sunflowers, rose bushes, and palm trees are not typically adapted to low rainfall areas and would struggle to survive in such conditions. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) cacti.

This question requires knowledge about the adaptations of plants to different environments. In areas with low rainfall, plants that are adapted to conserve water are more likely to survive. One such plant is the cactus, which has the ability to store water in its stems and has specialized structures, such as spines, to reduce water loss. Option (A) is incorrect because sunflowers require moderate to high levels of rainfall. Option (C) is also incorrect because rose bushes require regular watering. Option (D) is incorrect because palm trees typically grow in tropical or subtropical environments with higher rainfall.

This question requires basic knowledge about the adaptability of vegetation to different environments. In areas with low rainfall, vegetation needs to be able to survive with limited water supply. Cacti are well-suited for this type of environment because they have adapted to store water in their stems and have modified leaves to reduce water loss through transpiration. Option (A) is incorrect because sunflowers typically require more water to grow. Option (C) is also incorrect because rose bushes require regular watering. Option (D) is incorrect because while palm trees can withstand some drought conditions, they generally thrive in areas with higher rainfall.
